===Egypt===
===Egypt===
â
On 16 January, Egypt's [[CASE 30|EGX]] stock market index fell on speculation the instability would spread.<ref>[http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-01-16/egypt-stocks-drop-most-in-six-weeks-as-tunisia-s-leader-ben-ali-overthrown.html Egypt Stocks Drop Most in Six Weeks on Concern Tunisia Unrest May Spread â Bloomberg<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Protests in Egypt also led to a restaurant owner, Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafara, setting himself on fire. On 18 January, two other self-immolations, one by a lawyer in Cairo and another by an unemployed 25-year-old in Alexandria, were reported.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12214090 BBC News - Egyptian man dies after setting himself alight<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Many Egyptians have set up ''Facebook'' pages calling for 25 January, Egypt's 'National Police Day' to be "a day of revolution against torture, poverty, corruption and unemployment."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12204999|title=Man sets himself on fire in Cairo protest}}</ref>
+
On 16 January, Egypt's [[CASE 30|EGX]] stock market index fell on speculation the instability would spread.<ref>[http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-01-16/egypt-stocks-drop-most-in-six-weeks-as-tunisia-s-leader-ben-ali-overthrown.html Egypt Stocks Drop Most in Six Weeks on Concern Tunisia Unrest May Spread â Bloomberg<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Protests in Egypt also led to a restaurant owner, Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafara, setting himself on fire. On 18 January, two other self-immolations, one by a lawyer in Cairo and another by an unemployed 25-year-old in Alexandria, were reported.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12214090 BBC News - Egyptian man dies after setting himself alight<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Many Egyptians have set up ''Facebook'' pages calling for 25 January, Egypt's 'National Police Day' to be "a day of revolution against torture, poverty, corruption and unemployment."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12204999|title=Man sets himself on fire in Cairo protest}}</ref>. Egypt is [[Semi-presidential system|Semi-presidential]] [[republic]] under [[State of emergency|Emergency Law]] (Law No. 162 of 1958)<ref>[http://www.emerglobal.com/lex/law-1958-162 Law 1958/162 (Emergency Law)] {{ar}} at [http://emerglobal.com/lex EMERglobal Lex], part of the [[Edinburgh Middle East Report]]. Retrieved 2010-04-02.</ref> since 1967, except for an 18-month break in 1980.
Potential [[Egyptian presidential election, 2011|presidential candidate]] [[Mohamed ElBaradei]] warned of a "Tunisia-style explosion" in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theage.com.au/world/warning-egypt-could-follow-tunisia-20110119-19wly.html|title=Warning Egypt could follow Tunisia|author=Jack Shenker}}</ref>
